tiles.title: Create private SSL/TLS certificates
tiles.description: You can now use Secrets Manager to create a private certificate authority (CA) that you can use to issue SSL/TLS certificates to your internal applications. By configuring root and intermediate CAs for your instance, you can establish a valid chain of trust for your certificates.

tiles.title: Integrations with Kubernetes Service and Red Hat OpenShift for IBM Cloud
tiles.description: You can now use Secrets Manager to centrally manage Ingress subdomain certificates and other secrets for your Kubernetes or Red Hat OpenShift on IBM Cloud clusters.

tiles.title: New pricing plans and regions now available
tiles.description: Create an unlimited number of instances in your account by upgrading your Secrets Manager instance to the Standard plan. Additionally, you can now create an instance of the service in the Osaka and Toronto regions.

tiles.title: Tutorial series: Setting up alerts for expiring certificates
tiles.description: Looking for examples on how to send expiry alerts to GitHub or Slack? Check out the new tutorial series to learn how to enable your Secrets Manager instance for notifications, use webhooks to forward your post your alerts to GitHub, and more.
